005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.library;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.DynamicContext;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.ISequence;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.MetapathConstants;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.FunctionUtils;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.IArgument;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.IFunction;
014import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.IItem;
015import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.IBooleanItem;
016import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.IStringItem;
017
018import java.util.List;
019
020import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
021
022/**
023 * Implements the XPath 3.1 <a href=
024 * "https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions-31/#func-starts-with">fn:starts-with</a>
025 * function.
026 */
027public final class FnStartsWith {
028  // CPD-OFF
029  @NonNull
030  private static final String NAME = "starts-with";
031  @NonNull
032  static final IFunction SIGNATURE = IFunction.builder()
033      .name(NAME)
034      .namespace(MetapathConstants.NS_METAPATH_FUNCTIONS)
035      .deterministic()
036      .contextDependent()
037      .focusIndependent()
038      .argument(IArgument.builder()
039          .name("arg1")
040          .type(IStringItem.type())
041          .zeroOrOne()
042          .build())
043      .argument(IArgument.builder()
044          .name("arg2")
045          .type(IStringItem.type())
046          .zeroOrOne()
047          .build())
048      .returnType(IBooleanItem.type())
049      .returnOne()
050      .functionHandler(FnStartsWith::execute)
051      .build();
052  // CPD-ON
053
054  @SuppressWarnings("unused")
055  @NonNull
056  private static ISequence<IBooleanItem> execute(@NonNull IFunction function,
057      @NonNull List<ISequence<?>> arguments,
058      @NonNull DynamicContext dynamicContext,
059      IItem focus) {
060    IStringItem arg1 = FunctionUtils.asTypeOrNull(arguments.get(0).getFirstItem(true));
061
062    IStringItem arg2 = FunctionUtils.asTypeOrNull(arguments.get(1).getFirstItem(true));
063
064    return ISequence.of(IBooleanItem.valueOf(
065        fnStartsWith(
066            arg1 == null ? "" : arg1.asString(),
067            arg2 == null ? "" : arg2.asString())));
068  }
069
070  /**
071   * Determine if the string provided in the first argument contains the string in
072   * the second argument as a leading substring.
073   * <p>
074   * Based on the XPath 3.1 <a href=
075   * "https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions-31/#func-starts-with">fn:starts-with</a>
076   * function.
077   *
078   * @param arg1
079   *          the string to examine
080   * @param arg2
081   *          the string to check as the leading substring
082   * @return {@code true} if {@code arg1} starts with {@code arg2}, or
083   *         {@code false} otherwise
084   */
085  public static boolean fnStartsWith(@NonNull String arg1, @NonNull String arg2) {
086    boolean retval;
087    if (arg2.isEmpty()) {
088      retval = true;
089    } else if (arg1.isEmpty()) {
090      retval = false;
091    } else {
092      retval = arg1.startsWith(arg2);
093    }
094    return retval;
095  }
096
097  private FnStartsWith() {
098    // disable construction
099  }
100}
